Title: SQL Language Expressions
Description: The ISNULL operator is used to test if an expression is NULL. It returns true if the expression is NULL, and false if it is not NULL.
Parameters: An expression to test for NULL.
Returns: True if the expression is NULL; otherwise, false.
Examples: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date IS NULL; -- Finds orders where the order date is NULL
SELECT COALESCE(discount, 0) FROM products; -- Uses 0 if discount is NULL
